properties.areaDesc: Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas out 20 NM; Gulf waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 NM out and beyond 5 fathoms; Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas 20 to 60 NM out
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 31 at 5:49PM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 nm west of Dry Tortugas
out 60 nm...
Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel...
Gulf Waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 nm out and
beyond 5 fathoms...

At 545 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated potentially severe
thunderstorms, centered about 50 nm northwest of Tortugas Ecological
Reserve South, moving east at 40 knots. These storms are likely to
reach the waters near Fort Jefferson and Dry Tortugas soon after 7
pm.

Locations impacted include...
Rebecca Shoal Light, Dry Tortugas, Pulaski Shoal Light, Tortugas
Ecological Reserve South, Dry Tortugas Light, Tortugas Ecological
Reserve North and Fort Jefferson.

Prepare for severe thunderstorm wind gusts to 50 knots, prolific
lightning, blinding downpours, and hail. Use this lead time to get
to port. Stay tuned for the issuance of any warnings.

NWSheadline: STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL APPROACH THE GULF WATERS WEST OF THE DRY TORTUGAS
